greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = Product_{ odd primes p | n } (1 + Legendre(-1,p) ).
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
reference: G. Shimura, Introduction to the Arithmetic Theory of Automorphic Functions, Princeton, 1971, see p. 25, Eq. (2) (but without the restriction that a(4k) = 0).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Here we use the definition that Legendre(-1, 2) = 0, Legendre(-1, p) = 1 if p == 1 mod 4, = -1 if p == 3 mod 4. This is Shimura's definition, which is different from Maple's.
Expansion of (phi(q)^2 - phi(q^9)^2) / 4 in powers of q where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
a(n) = Sum_{d|n} b(d)*(-1)^bigomega(d)*moebius(d) where b(2n)=0 and b(2n+1)=(-1)^n. - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 17 2016
G.f.: ((Sum_{k in Z} x^k^2)^2 - (Sum_{k in Z} x^(9*k^2))^2) / 4. - _Michael Somos_, Jan 26 2017
maple: with(numtheory): A091400 := proc(n) local i,t1,t2; t1 := ifactors(n)[2]; t2 := 1; for i from 1 to nops(t1) do if t1[i][1] > 2 then t2 := t2*(1+legendre(-1,t1[i][1])); fi; od: t2; end;
with(numtheory): seq(mul(1+legendre(-1,p),p in select(isprime, divisors(n) minus {2})),n=1..105); # _Peter Luschny_, Apr 20 2016
mathematica: Legendre[-1, p_] := Which[p==2, 0, Mod[p, 4]==1, 1, True, -1]; a[1] = 1; a[n_] := Times @@ (Legendre[-1, #] + 1&) /@ FactorInteger[n][[All, 1]]; Array[a, 105] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 01 2015 *)
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ (EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q]^2 - EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q^9]^2) / 4, {q, 0, n}]; (* _Michael Somos_, Jan 26 2017 *)
program: (PARI) {a(n) = if( n<1, 0, sumdiv(n, d, kronecker(-9, d) * kronecker(36, n/d)))}; /* _Michael Somos_, Jan 26 2017 */
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 02 2004
